experiences.title: Tech Associate, Instructor @ [Learn 01](https://learn01.io/)
experiences.summary:
- **Taught groups of 50+** entry level students topics involving computer programming, algorithms, and cybersecurity.
- Conducted **Organized and planned 100+** person events such as hackathons and competitive programming tournaments
- Contributed to the development of customizable and enjoyable student based curriculum that is still in use.

experiences.title: CAD Intern, Instructor @ [Delta Design](http://deltacreate.com/)
experiences.summary:
- Gained proficiency in CAD and technical drawings, going through several iterations to meet customer demands.
 - **Helped produce 1000+** customizable 3D printable Mickey Mouse Ears , from design to production to customer.
- Volunteered at local charity events for Delta and improved public speaking by promoting the company.

experiences.title: Head Programmer, Instructor @ [MBSH Robotics Club](https://miamibeachbots.webflow.io/)
experiences.subtitle: First Robotics
experiences.summary:
- Founded the MBSH Robotics Club in 2018 and helped grow the club **from 4 to over ** recurring members.
- Led the programming and electrical subteams, **placing 4/33** in the South Florida 2022 FIRST Robotics Competition.
- Led Python/Java classes, taught others how to program AI smart camera tracking and explained how to hard wire drivetrain modules for advanced movement capabilities.

experiences.title: President @ [MBSH STEAM Club](https://twitter.com/MBSHSTEAM)
experiences.subtitle: STEAM Gold Designated
experiences.summary:
- Coordinated with **~10 local tech leaders** to give weekly talks on business, art, and health for **over 30 club members**
- Managed 3 teams of 5+ as they constructed a water bottle rocket, egg-drop mechanism, and water wheel generator for regional competitions, helping the school become gold designated in STEAM.

experiences.title: Member @ [Association of Computer Science Undergraduates](https://acsu.cornell.edu/)
experiences.summary:
- Promote professional, social, and educational interaction among students interested in computer science.
- Facilitate students' communication with CS faculty, alumni, and corporate representatives.
- Cornell University’s chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery.
